Description: Neck sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater; interior glazed with red band lined in white; exterior, white slip: two part-preserved antithetic lions rampant with raised paws; between them a pendent palmette; red paint on neck and foreleg of lions and on parts of palmette; scanty incision used for details.
Curator's comments: There is a slight out-turn at the top of the sherd, strongly suggesting that it is from the neck of a krater. 'A975' pencilled on inside.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.214)
